title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 06 June 2013 - XWiki
content:

09:54 <vmassol> chalx: good morning, see my comment on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCONTRIB-207#comment-75751  
09:55 <chalx> vmassol, ok i set it now  
10:21 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:51 <chalx> how I can include dependencies in a xar with maven ?  
10:56 <gdelhumeau> yes you can  
10:56 <vmassol> chalx: using <dependencies> elements, check other extensions's pom.xml  
10:56 <chalx> vmassol, ok I check now  
11:11 <vmassol> hmmm just closed one bug but it doesn't appear on http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?filter=12305  
11:11 <vmassol> any idea?  
11:11 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9203  
11:12 <vmassol> ok it works if I change the dates, fixig  
11:13 <vmassol> I have not understood this aspect of jira yet...  
11:36 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:37 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:39 <vmassol> msmeria: ping  
12:39 <msmeria> vmassol: hi  
12:39 <vmassol> msmeria: not sure what you wish us to do with http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9205#  
12:40 <msmeria> I just tested this with permgen set to 196Mb and I didn't got the error anymore  
12:40 <Slashman> has quit  
12:40 <msmeria> I thought XWiki is supposed to work with Tomcat out of the box  
12:40 <vmassol> msmeria: nope  
12:40 <msmeria> with no changes applied..  
12:40 <vmassol> we don't provide a bundle  
12:40 <vmassol> for tomcat  
12:40 <vmassol> only for jetty  
12:41 <sburjan> :(  
12:41 <vmassol> it's clearly marked  
12:41 <vmassol> here:  
12:41 <sburjan> sad. I am sad  
12:41 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HPrerequisites  
12:41 <vmassol> ? Check the http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/WebHome for the version you're installing to see what browse  
12:41 <vmassol> "  
12:41 <vmassol> why are you sad?  
12:42 <msmeria> I read it now  
12:42 <vmassol> only now? :)  
12:42 <sburjan> because DW is a hungry beast :( And we are having so many issues with it.. from OOM to ultra slowness. It's that slow that we can't even test properly, an upgrade takes sometimes more than 1 hour !  
12:42 <msmeria> I mean more thourough  
12:42 <vmassol> sburjan: don't mix issues  
12:42 <sburjan> I am not. There are 2 separate issues.  
12:43 <sburjan> the OOM thing and the slowness  
12:43 <sburjan> but increasing the momory does NOT fix the slowness  
12:43 <vmassol> regarding OOM it'll be fixed in java8  
12:43 <vmassol> with the dissapearance of permgen memory  
12:44 <sburjan> interesting. didn't know about their intention to remove permgen  
12:44 <vmassol> actually might even 7  
12:44 <sburjan> this will be good news in about .. 4 years :)  
12:44 <vmassol> http://javaeesupportpatterns.blogspot.fr/2011/10/java-7-features-permgen-removal.html  
12:44 <vmassol> "UPDATE: PermGen space is official removed in http://javaeesupportpatterns.blogspot.com/2013/02/java-8-from-permgen-to-metaspace.html and replaced by http://javaeesupportpatterns.blogspot.com/2013/02/java-8-from-permgen-to-metaspace.html."  
12:44 <Slashman\_> has quit  
12:45 <vmassol> "Interned strings, for example, have already been removed from the PermGen space since JDK 7"  
12:45 <vmassol> so it's possible that jdk7 requires less permgen too  
12:45 <sburjan> vmassol: odd that I always imagines that xwiki works with ALL containers without ANY additional memory settings  
12:45 <sburjan> \*imagined  
12:46 <vmassol> sburjan: errr?  
12:46 <vmassol> you don't understand  
12:46 <vmassol> the container does nothing  
12:46 <vmassol> it's not related ot the container at all  
12:46 <vmassol> it's related to the JVM  
12:46 <vmassol> the memory you give to the JVM  
12:46 <vmassol> so it depends completely and only on the startup script you use to start your container  
12:46 <sburjan> well then how come with jetty you don't have to manually increase memory ?  
12:46 <vmassol> nothing to do wixth jetty  
12:46 <vmassol> \*with  
12:47 <vmassol> it's just because we set the memory in start\_xwiki.sh  
12:47 <sburjan> so WE in start\_xwiki.sh are setting a higher memory than tomcat's default ? this is why tomcat is failing ?  
12:48 <vmassol> tomcat doesn't set any memory AFAIK  
12:48 <vmassol> it's the jvm default  
12:48 <vmassol> but yes  
12:48 <sburjan> ok, I see  
12:48 <sburjan> ok, this makes sense  
12:49 <sburjan> so bypassing thge settings from start\_xwiki.sh .. won't allocate enough memory  
12:49 <sburjan> this is why deploying xwiki in a vanilla tomcat introduces these issues  
12:50 <vmassol> as a sysadmin it's your job to set the memory properly  
12:50 <sburjan> because more lately I have becon the adept of manual installs, manually deploy into tomcat, etc.. without using start\_xwiki.sh or stuff like these  
12:50 <sburjan> \*becone  
12:50 <sburjan> \*become  
12:50 <vmassol> same as it's your job to isntall the jdk/jre  
12:50 <vmassol> ofc  
12:50 <vmassol> it would be nicer if xwiki uses less memory  
12:51 <sburjan> so this means XWiki was a big memory eater for a long time, I was thinking something changed recently, something we missed  
12:51 <vmassol> oh we keep increasing memory needs all the time unfortunately  
12:52 <vmassol> more 3rd party frameworks, more caching to improve perfs  
12:52 <vmassol> at some point we should do some more memory profiling to understand better our memory usages  
12:53 <sburjan> ok, so now I have clarified the memory thing :)  
12:53 <sburjan> now we still have the slowness issue  
12:54 <evalica> has quit  
12:57 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:00 <mflorea> has quit  
13:12 <vmassol> has quit  
13:13 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:14 <sburjan> vmassol: we have downloaded a clean jetty from the web and with no memory tuning, we don't get OOM  
13:15 <sdumitriu> It never worked on Tomcat for a long time without increasing the memory  
13:16 <vmassol> sburjan: it depends on lots of stuff  
13:16 <vmassol> if you have one byte over you get an OOM  
13:16 <sdumitriu> We tune Jetty already in our start.sh  
13:16 <vmassol> the container also loads classes  
13:16 <sdumitriu> Other containers also come with bigger default memory settings  
13:17 <sburjan> sdumitriu: yes, but I am testing with a clean downloaded jetty. I am starting it with java -jvat start.jar  
13:17 <sdumitriu> Tomcat is conservative and lets the sysadmin tune it  
13:17 <vmassol> they all do  
13:17 <vmassol> they're java apps  
13:17 <vmassol> so they can't control it anyway  
13:17 <sburjan> ok, so by default Jetty starts with more memory than Tomcat ?  
13:17 <vmassol> it only dpends on the script you use to start the jvm  
13:17 <vmassol> sburjan: again no  
13:17 <vmassol> again it's only the JVM  
13:17 <vmassol> the contauner runs \*\*inside\*\* the JVM  
13:18 <vmassol> it has no control on the JVM settings  
13:18 <vmassol> again  
13:18 <vmassol> it's only the startup script that starts the JVM with the memory settings  
13:18 <vmassol> not sure what's not clear with that....  
13:19 <sburjan> yes, I understand that. I am just trying to figure out why clean jetty works and clean tomcat doesn't. I am not modifying any memory setting.  
13:19 <vmassol> if you run java -jar start.jar  
13:19 <sburjan> so this means that they both should start with the default JVM memory  
13:19 <vmassol> you say: start with default JVM memory settings  
13:19 <sburjan> exactly  
13:19 <vmassol> and again  
13:19 <vmassol> the difference is that container have their own code and third party libs to load  
13:20 <sburjan> I'm just trying to get an OOM on a clean jetty :)  
13:20 <sburjan> I see  
13:20 <vmassol> call a page with the code macro in it  
13:20 <sdumitriu> sburjan: Run a {{code}} macro  
13:20 <vmassol> that should help  
13:20 <sdumitriu> run a {{grrovy}} macro  
13:20 <sdumitriu> And you should get some  
13:20 <sburjan> ok, let's see  
13:21 <vmassol> run yourkit  
13:21 <vmassol> you'll see the memory used in realtime  
13:21 <vmassol> and what uses the memory  
13:21 <vmassol> and when gc is called  
13:23 <vmassol> bb in 1 hour  
13:25 <sburjan> sdumitriu: bingo. Permger  
13:25 <sburjan> \*permgen  
13:26 <sburjan> so jetty is a little bit lighter than tomcat this is why it didn't fail .. while under the same JVM memory  Tomcat failed  
13:26 <sburjan> is this a rational explanation ?  
13:26 <sburjan> but using the code macro in a jetty container, quickly permgen'd  
13:31 <sdumitriu> Yes, that's the explanation  
13:32 <sdumitriu> Compare the size of the jars in jetty/lib and in tomcat/lib  
13:34 <sburjan> sdumitriu: they both have 6 MB  
13:34 <sdumitriu> Really?  
13:34 <sburjan> yes  
13:34 <sdumitriu> I have 3M for Tomcat and 1.5M for Jetty  
13:35 <sdumitriu> Oh, also note that Jetty doesn't load all of them  
13:35 <sburjan> I have compared their size on disk  
13:36 <sburjan> sdumitriu: Tomcat 6 or 7 ?  
13:36 <msmeria> sdumitriu: maybe you have a different version  
13:36 <sdumitriu> Depends on what OPTION do you pass to start.jar  
13:36 <sdumitriu> 7  
13:36 <sdumitriu> But I have Gentoo, which is tuned  
13:36 <sburjan> yes, but you have tomcat and jetty downloaded from thei official website as a zip or installed using emerge ?  
13:37 <sburjan> but.. they are jasrs, so what gentoo specific optimizations can they have ...  
13:37 <sburjan> (confused)  
13:38 <sdumitriu> emerge  
13:38 <sburjan> I have the zip download, and my Tomcat/lib has 6.2 mb  
13:40 <sdumitriu> http://pastebin.com/7PHyiVXD  
13:41 <sdumitriu> Also, keep in mind that PermGen is for all applications  
13:41 <sdumitriu> And Tomcat comes with a few apps as well  
13:41 <sdumitriu> manager, docs  
13:42 <chalx> has quit  
13:48 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:52 <sburjan`> has quit  
13:52 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
13:59 <sdumitriu> Anyway, we clearly document the memory requirements  
14:00 <altker1281> has quit  
14:01 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:05 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:16 <sburjan> sdumitriu: yes indeed, Tomcat comes with other apps as well. This makes sense now  
14:46 <fm\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:50 <fm\_\_> has quit  
14:51 <qwebirc80188> has joined #xwiki  
14:51 <vmassol> msmeria/sburjan: do you think you could beef up the documentation for autowatch on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Watchlist+Application#HAutoWatch ?  
14:51 <qwebirc80188> has left #xwiki  
14:52 <vmassol> it's missing some screenshot and explanation about what the "default" value does (cf the question asked by Oana)  
14:53 <vmassol> qwebirc21837: hi, I'm curious. What's your name IRL? :)  
14:55 <vmassol> qwebirc21837: you connected through the IRC client on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/IRC ?  
14:55 <qwebirc29140> has joined #xwiki  
14:56 <qwebirc29140> hi  
14:56 <qwebirc29140> my name is Vincent, Vincent Massol :)  
14:56 <evalica> :)  
14:57 <msmeria> vmassol: I could do it when I have time, but the thing is I also don't know what the default value does  
14:57 <vmassol> default takes the value from xwiki.cfg  
14:58 <qwebirc29140> has left #xwiki  
14:58 <vmassol> thanks msmeria, I'll leave it to you then  
14:58 <msmeria> vmassol: no problem  
15:00 <sburjan> vmassol: what happens ito the version if a contrib application has a dependency to a module from platform ? like xwiki-platform-livetable-ui ? For example xwiki.org is on 4.5.2 and my dependency is to version 5.0 ?  
15:01 <vmassol> it means at least the value you specified  
15:01 <sburjan> so in order to be deployed successfully, I have to lower my dependency version from 5.0 to 4.5.4, right ?  
15:02 <vmassol> yes  
15:02 <vmassol> or upgrade xwiki.org  
15:02 <sburjan> thanks. COmmitting final changes and trying to release it today  
15:06 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:11 <tillo> has quit  
15:11 <sburjan`> has quit  
15:11 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
15:11 <sburjan> vmassol: it would \_really\_ help if you could do a quick review of https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-testreporting/blob/master/pom.xml when you have 3 minutes  
15:12 <tillo> has joined #xwiki  
15:20 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
15:21 <vmassol> sburjan: you're sure you want that? :)  
15:21 <vmassol> it might not help and instead it might cause you delays!  
15:21 <sburjan> :)  
15:21 <vmassol> 8 BFD todays, a few more would be great  
15:21 <vmassol> -30 ATM  
15:21 <sburjan> as long as it gets and runs properly to xwiki.org I think I'll take the risk. But I am still scared of you :)  
15:21 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: check my pull requests ;)  
15:21 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you sent 2  
15:21 <vmassol> one is- ?1 by thomas and I agree  
15:21 <gdelhumeau> I'm talking with him about it  
15:21 <vmassol> ok  
15:21 <vmassol> the other one is dangerous  
15:21 <vmassol> because it's not backward compat AFAICS  
15:22 <gdelhumeau> well, the old behaviour was bad...  
15:22 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
15:23 <vmassol> sure but you need to asses the potential issues for existing users and present that if you wish to break some backward compat  
15:23 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
15:23 <vmassol> in this case it means assessing who could have implemented XWikiGroupService  
15:23 <vmassol> do we have users or extensions that would implement it?  
15:24 <vmassol> then we need to decide if we're ok to break those persons or not  
15:24 <vmassol> and if so, it means adding a clirr exclude and documentation in the RN  
15:24 <vmassol> it's not something that should be decided lightly  
15:25 <gdelhumeau> well, in a client project that I have, I have users in group A, which is member of group B, and when I ask "is the suer member of group B?", the API says "no"  
15:26 <gdelhumeau> Ok. Maybe someone has implemented a class of XWikiGroupService. I didn't understand, sorry  
15:26 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: that's why we have CLIRR ;) to notice our breakages  
15:27 <vmassol> if you run the build it'll fail locally  
15:27 <vmassol> for oldcore the check is done in xwiki-platform-legacy/xwiki-platform-legacy-oldcore  
15:27 <vmassol> try building it locally and you'll see it fails  
15:27 <vmassol> (with your changes ofc)  
15:30 <gdelhumeau> I'm gonna try others fixs, then :p  
15:31 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I'm not saying your fix is bad, I don't know about that  
15:31 <vmassol> I'm jsut saying that since it breaks an api  
15:31 <vmassol> you need to make a proposal or at least explain clearly in the issue why you think it's ok even though it breaks an api, what are the rissks and what users need to do  
15:32 <vmassol> because our default rule  
15:32 <vmassol> is to never break an api  
15:32 <vmassol> see  
15:32 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices#HBackwardCompatibility  
15:33 <vmassol> if there's a solution that works without breaking the api then it's better ofc :)  
15:33 <vmassol> this is some oldcore code that will need to be rewritten and moved to components  
15:34 <vmassol> so another possibiltiy is to make a proposal for a new user / group module (cf discussion with sergiu yesterday) but that's much bigger :)  
15:34 <gdelhumeau> actually I have added a new method to not change the behaviour of the existing ones ^^  
15:34 <vmassol> :)  
15:37 <gdelhumeau> I fix a problem on a client and I go back with an other proposal :p  
15:37 <vmassol> ok  
15:50 <sburjan> vmassol: don't forget about me :)  
15:50 <vmassol> I won't have the time today sburjan  
15:50 <vmassol> for sure  
15:50 <vmassol> and probably not this week  
15:51 <sburjan> well it was a very short pom.xml file  
15:51 <vmassol> ok thought you wanted  a full review of the app  
15:52 <vmassol> why <version>5.0</version>  
15:52 <vmassol> "Makes easier following and executing the Manual Test Reports" is not correct English  
15:52 <vmassol> <inceptionYear>2013</inceptionYear> not needed  
15:52 <vmassol> (but ok)  
15:53 <vmassol>  <tag>HEAD</tag> should be removed  
15:53 <vmassol> rest looks ok  
15:55 <sburjan> vmassol: thanks :)  
15:55 <sburjan> what should I put for version instead of 5.0 ?  
15:55 <vmassol> if you want to be on the 5.x branch  
15:55 <vmassol> then 5.0.3  
15:55 <vmassol> if you want to be on the 4.5 branch, then 4.5.3  
15:56 <vmassol> actually it dpeends what you want the minimal version of XWiki to be  
15:56 <vmassol> your choice  
15:56 <vmassol> you just need to ensure it works with it and later versions  
15:56 <vmassol> :)  
15:57 <tmortagne> sburjan: usually you put the lowest version you want your extension to work on  
15:58 <tmortagne> (to be sure you don't use some API that exist only on recent version)  
16:05 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:21 <vmassol> mflorea: ping  
16:23 <mflorea> vmassol: pong  
16:23 <vmassol> mflorea: when I use a List of Users xproperty, I get the following in the livetable json: "users\_value":"Admin"  
16:23 <vmassol> ie not the full name  
16:23 <vmassol> the problem is  
16:24 <vmassol> UsersClass returns the full name when getList() is called  
16:24 <vmassol> (I'm actually implementing getMap() ATM to fix http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8836# )  
16:25 <vmassol> since my getMap uses getList I get XWiki.Admin as the value  
16:25 <vmassol> so it doesn't match when filtering the LT  
16:25 <vmassol> so we need to decide who's right  
16:25 <vmassol> :)  
16:26 <vmassol> FYI this is what I have ATM: https://gist.github.com/vmassol/5721898  
16:26 <mflorea> why is "users\_value":"Admin"?  
16:26 <vmassol> (I have just implemented getMap(), getList() already exists)  
16:26 <vmassol> hmm I don't know I thought you coded that  
16:27 <vmassol> hence my question  
16:27 <vmassol> :)  
16:27 <mflorea> :)  
16:27 <mflorea> I coded the displayer  
16:27 <mflorea> "Admin" is clearly not the output of the displayer  
16:27 <mflorea> user displayer  
16:28 <vmassol> ok I'll dig  
16:30 <mflorea> vmassol: #set($fieldValue = "$!itemDoc.getValue($colname)")  
16:30 <mflorea> in LiveTableResultsMacros  
16:30 <vmassol> yep  
16:30 <mflorea> then #set($discard = $row.put("${colname}\_value", $fieldValue))  
16:30 <mflorea> so it seems it come from the query  
16:40 <vmassol> so "Admin" is actually the value stored in the xobject  
16:41 <vmassol> that's what the displayer saves apparently  
16:41 <vmassol> (mflorea)  
16:41 <vmassol> where is the code of the list of user displayer?  
16:42 <mflorea> templates/displayer\_users.vm  
16:42 <vmassol> mflorea: https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/3b846dfd-a47c-4b95-8253-872cf15a9adc/1303495a7b683839e49196990a88c4f1  
16:42 <vmassol> so maybe we should save XWiki.Admin instead  
16:42 <mflorea> no  
16:43 <mflorea> that's just display  
16:43 <mflorea> it's the user alias  
16:43 <mflorea> I don't display "XWiki" because it's tehnical  
16:43 <mflorea> but that's not what is saved
